1 // $Id: StringListOperator.js 175 2008-08-29 09:43:38Z bobbicat71 $
  2 
  3 Ext.namespace('Ext.ux.netbox.string');
  4 
  5 /** It instantiates a new StringListOperator
  6   * @class This is the class that implements an operator that allows the choice of more than one value (from a list)
  7   * @constructor
  8   * @extends Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator
  9   * @param {String} id The id of the operator.
 10   * @param {String} label The label of the operator.
 11   */
 12 Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator = function(id,label) {
 13   Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator.superclass.constructor.call(this,id,label);
 14   /** With this operator I want always a combo with multiple choice. The editor that implements the behaviour is Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor
 15     * If available values are not available (isAvailableValuesAvailable  returns false) an exception is thrown
 16     * @property {Ext.Editor} editor
 17     */
 18   this.editor=null;
 19   valFn=function(values){
 20     return(this.getField().emptyNotAllowedFn(values));
 21   }
 22   this.addValidateFn(valFn);
 23 }
 24 
 25 Ext.extend(Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator,Ext.ux.netbox.core.Operator,/** @scope Ext.ux.netbox.string.StringListOperator.prototype */{
 26   /** This method creates an Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor as editor.
 27     * @param {String} operatorId The operatorId actually used in the filter
 28     * @return {Ext.Editor} The field used to edit the values of this filter
 29     */
 30   createEditor: function(operatorId){
 31     var editor=new Ext.ux.netbox.core.AvailableValuesEditor(this.getField().getAvailableValues(),{remote: this.isStoreRemote(),forceReload: this.isForceReload(),multiSelect: true,caseSensitive: this.isCaseSensitive()});
 32     return editor;
 33   },
 34   /** This method convert an old value of an elementary filter to a new value, suitable for this operator.
 35     * <B>NB:</B> if you want to return an empty operator return [].
 36     * In this default implementation, if it's an array, it returns all the element of the array in the format {value:...,label:...} 
 37     * an array with only the first element is returned. Otherwise it returns an empty array.
 38     * @param {Array of Object} values
 39     */
 40   convertValue: function(values){
 41     var toReturn=[];
 42     if(values !==null && values !== undefined && Ext.type(values)=="array"){
 43       for(var i=0;i<values.length;i++){
 44         if(values[i].value!== undefined && values[i].label!== undefined){
 45           toReturn.push(values[i]);
 46         }
 47       }
 48     }
 49     return(toReturn);
 50   }
 51 });
